verses.verse: He that separateth<WH6504> himself seeketh<WH1245> his own desire<WH8378>, And rageth<WH1566> against all sound wisdom<WH8454>.
A fool<WH3684> hath no delight<WH2654> in understanding<WH8394>, But only that his heart<WH3820> may reveal itself<WH1540>.
When the wicked<WH7563> cometh<WH935>, there cometh<WH935> also contempt<WH937>, And with ignominy<WH7036> cometh reproach<WH2781>.
The words<WH1697> of a man<WH376>'s mouth<WH6310> are as deep<WH6013> waters<WH4325>; The wellspring<WH4726> of wisdom<WH2451> is as a flowing<WH5042> brook<WH5158>.
To respect<WH5375> the person<WH6440> of the wicked<WH7563> is not good<WH2896>, Nor to turn aside<WH5186> the righteous<WH6662> in judgment<WH4941>.
A fool<WH3684>'s lips<WH8193> enter<WH935> into contention<WH7379>, And his mouth<WH6310> calleth<WH7121> for stripes<WH4112>.
A fool<WH3684>'s mouth<WH6310> is his destruction<WH4288>, And his lips<WH8193> are the snare<WH4170> of his soul<WH5315>.
The words<WH1697> of a whisperer<WH5372> are as dainty morsels<WH3859>, And they go down<WH3381> into the<WH990> innermost parts<WH2315>.
He also that is slack<WH7503> in his work<WH4399> Is brother<WH251> to him that is a<WH1167> destroyer<WH7843>.
The name<WH8034> of Jehovah<WH3068> is a strong<WH5797> tower<WH4026>; The righteous<WH6662> runneth<WH7323> into it<WH7682>, and is safe.
The rich man<WH6223>'s wealth<WH1952> is his strong<WH5797> city<WH7151>, And as a high<WH7682> wall<WH2346> in his own imagination<WH4906>.
Before <WH6440> destruction<WH7667> the heart<WH3820> of man<WH376> is haughty<WH1361>; And before<WH6440> honor<WH3519> goeth humility<WH6038>.
He that giveth<WH1697> answer<WH7725> before he heareth<WH8085>, It is folly<WH200> and shame unto him<WH3639>.
The spirit<WH7307> of a man<WH376> will sustain<WH3557> his infirmity<WH4245>; But a broken<WH5218> spirit<WH7307> who can bear<WH5375>?
The heart<WH3820> of the prudent<WH995> getteth<WH7069> knowledge<WH1847>; And the ear<WH241> of the wise<WH2450> seeketh<WH1245> knowledge<WH1847>.
A man<WH120>'s gift<WH4976> maketh room<WH7337> for him<WH5148>, And bringeth him before<WH6440> great men<WH1419>.
He that pleadeth his cause<WH7379> first<WH7223> seemeth just<WH6662>; But his neighbor<WH7453> cometh<WH935> and searcheth him out<WH2713>.
The lot<WH1486> causeth contentions<WH4079> to cease<WH7673>, And parteth<WH6504> between the mighty<WH6099>.
A brother<WH251> offended<WH6586> is harder to be won than a strong<WH5797> city<WH7151>; And such contentions<WH4079> are like the bars<WH1280> of a castle<WH759>.
A man<WH376>'s belly<WH990> shall be filled<WH7646> with the fruit<WH6529> of his mouth<WH6310>; With the increase<WH8393> of his lips<WH8193> shall he be satisfied<WH7646>.
Death <WH4194> and life<WH2416> are in the power<WH3027> of the tongue<WH3956>; And they that love<WH157> it shall eat<WH398> the fruit thereof<WH6529>.
Whoso findeth<WH4672> a wife<WH802> findeth<WH4672> a good<WH2896> thing<WH6329>, And obtaineth favor<WH7522> of Jehovah<WH3068>.
The poor<WH7326> useth<WH1696> entreaties<WH8469>; But the rich<WH6223> answereth<WH6030> roughly<WH5794>.
He <WH376> that maketh many friends<WH7453> doeth it to his own destruction<WH7489>; But there is<WH3426> a friend<WH157> that sticketh closer<WH1695> than a brother<WH251>.
